childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 onion, sliced
  • 1 medium-sized carrot, julienned or sliced into thin strips
  • 1 small cabbage, shredded
  • 1 medium-sized bell pepper, sliced
  • 1 cup green beans, ends trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
  • 1 cup snap peas (sitsaro), ends trimmed
  • 1 cup cauliflower florets
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Heat the cooking oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.

  2. Add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden.

  3. Add the sliced onion and sauté until translucent.

  4. Add the julienned carrots and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring frequently.

  5. Add the shredded cabbage, sliced bell pepper, green beans, snap peas, and cauliflower florets. Stir well to combine all the vegetables.

  6. Drizzle the soy sauce over the vegetables and continue to stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are cooked to your desired tenderness. You can adjust the cooking time based on your preference for crunchy or softer vegetables.

  7. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remember to add a little at a time and taste as you go.

  8. Remove from heat and transfer the Ginisang Gulay to a serving dish.

  9. Serve hot as a side dish or main course, along with steamed rice.

Feel free to modify the vegetables based on your preference or what you have on hand. Other commonly used vegetables in Ginisang Gulay include broccoli, snow peas, zucchini, or any other vegetables you enjoy.

Enjoy your flavorful and nutritious Ginisang Gulay!
